This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ACADEMICLIVERPOOL.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-27T11:17:20Z Victoria Higham 2015-02-27T11:05:52+00:00 2015-02-27T11:05:52+00:00 Atmospheres Conference, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - REGISTRATION NOW OPEN https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICLIVERPOOL;2ce3f785.1502 Registration is now open for our forthcoming Atmospheres Conference.<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in 'capturing' them.<br>In this major conference celebrating the 10th anniversary of the Morgan Centre, we will be using the theme of 'atmospheres' as our starting point for interdisciplinary dialogue. [...] Prof Bruce Hood 2015-02-23T17:10:40+00:00 2015-02-23T17:10:40+00:00 Speakezee.org https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICLIVERPOOL;68303ba9.1502 This will be of interest and use to Mersey academics<br>www.speakezee.org<br>A portal that connects experts with audiences just launched.<br>www.speakezee.org has a simple & elegant search function<br>and will be offering more functionality down the road to track<br>speaker activities & feedback for the next REF etc<br><br>Hope you like it,<br><br>Bruce Hood, PhD, FRI, FBPsS, FSB, FAPS<br>Chair of Developmental Psychology in Society<br>University of Bristol<br>http://speakezee.org/speaker/profile/118/bruce-hood Victoria Higham 2014-12-08T14:28:46+00:00 2014-12-08T14:28:46+00:00 Atmospheres Conference, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - CALL FOR ABSTRACTS https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICLIVERPOOL;f0a05bc9.1412 News from the Morgan Centre for Research into Everyday Lives, University of Manchester<br>Atmospheres, 1-2 July 2015, Call for Abstracts<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcapturing\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd them. This multi-disciplinary conference offers postgraduate students the opportunity to expand their spheres of awareness, as well as meet postgraduates from different fields and institutions. Housing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd A Critical Perspective https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICLIVERPOOL;da1c0fbe.1409 Hi all. This may be of interest:<br><br>Together with the Sociology Department of Liverpool University and the Architecture Department of Liverpool John Moores University, Architecture_MPS is organising a two day interdisciplinary conference on the theme of affordable housing provision. Forming part of a broader program of international events, Housing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Critical Futures, it is open to activists, artists and academics of all disciplines. It is set in Liverpool but seeks to link with national and global issues. Please<br>find the registration details and the conference programme at*:<br>http://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/humanity-and-animality-in-20th-and-21st-century-culture-narratives-theories-histories-an-tickets-12769440741?aff=es2<br><br>*If you are interested in attending the conference, please choose the<br>session(s) you would like attend from the multiple choice menu. *<br><br>*\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMany thanks and best wishes,*<br><br>*[image:<br>https://ci6.googleusercontent.com/proxy/RnNZfQn2o2xpggJQqefCOervMbPIci5mujDPJnvl43kv6Rtxjyh5gHN_JKVzeU-aaGz3pePFgxfoAAtZJZNx8mveVTc-11j98EfuAJVcumUenA=s0-d-e1-ft#https://ssl.gstatic.com/ui/v1/icons/mail/images/cleardot.gif][image:<br>https://ssl.gstatic.com/ui/v1/icons/mail/images/cleardot.gif]*<br><br>*Stefano Bellin*<br><br>University College London (UCL)<br><br>Joint Faculty Institute of Graduate Studies [...] Stefano Bellin 2014-09-01T12:35:08+01:00 2014-09-01T12:35:08+01:00 UCL Humanity and Animality Conference - Registration now open https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICLIVERPOOL;e300cff8.1409 Dear All,<br><br>Registration for the UCL Humanity and Animality conference is now open.<br>Please find the registration details and the conference programme at:<br>http://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/humanity-and-animality-in-20th-and-21st-century-culture-narratives-theories-histories-an-tickets-12769440741?aff=es2<br><br>If you are interested in attending the conference, please choose the<br>session(s) you would like attend from the multiple choice menu.<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMany thanks and best wishes,<br><br>[image:<br>https://ci6.googleusercontent.com/proxy/RnNZfQn2o2xpggJQqefCOervMbPIci5mujDPJnvl43kv6Rtxjyh5gHN_JKVzeU-aaGz3pePFgxfoAAtZJZNx8mveVTc-11j98EfuAJVcumUenA=s0-d-e1-ft#https://ssl.gstatic.com/ui/v1/icons/mail/images/cleardot.gif][image:<br>https://ssl.gstatic.com/ui/v1/icons/mail/images/cleardot.gif]<br><br>Stefano Bellin<br><br>University College London (UCL)<br><br>Joint Faculty Institute of Graduate Studies [...] Mark Westgarth 2014-07-31T16:44:44+01:00 2014-07-31T16:44:44+01:00 Period Room Conference, Bowes Museum 18-20 Sept https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICLIVERPOOL;ffe3d657.1407 Hello Researchers in Liverpool,<br><br>I thought you may be interested in a conference on The Period Room, to be held at Bowes Museum 18th-20th September.<br>Full programme and booking form is available on the Period Room Conference blog:<br><br>http://periodrooms.wordpress.com/<br><br>kindest regards<br>Mark Stefano Bellin 2014-07-10T01:13:08+01:00 2014-07-10T01:13:08+01:00 CFP Humanity and Animality Interdisciplinary Conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICLIVERPOOL;eddeb66a.1407 Call for papers:<br><br>University College London (UCL)<br><br>Joint Faculty Institute of Graduate Studies<br><br>*Humanity and Animality in 20th and 21st Century Culture:*<br><br>*Narratives, Theories, Histories. An Interdisciplinary Conference*<br><br>*15 September, 2014*<br><br>This interdisciplinary conference takes up an important debate in a field<br>of growing importance in the humanities, where animal studies,<br>post-humanism, and eco-criticism have surged in recent years. The<br>definition of mankind seems necessarily to pass through an understanding of<br>what constitutes the animal. Philosophically, what distinguishes, or indeed<br>brings together humanity and animality has been the subject of debate from<br>Aristotle\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds understanding of man as \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd*z\ufffd\ufffdon logon echon*\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [...] Annabel Banks 2014-05-02T12:54:40+01:00 2014-05-02T12:54:40+01:00 CFP - Writing Communities https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICLIVERPOOL;140e59ec.1405 Writing Communities: People as Place<br><br>Falmouth University PG/ECR Conference July 29th \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 30th 2014 (\ufffd\ufffd25)<br><br>Call for Papers<br><br>Researching place often means researching communities. Landscapes are peopled. History has a living voice. Researchers not only work with communities, but also write them\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcreatively and academically.<br><br>This Postgraduate / Early Career Researcher conference invites papers around the pleasures and tensions of writing with/from community engagement. Abstracts from creative writers, artists, historians, geographers and social scientists are particularly welcome, as well as from any PG/ECR whose research involves communities. [...]
